column1: Personal well-being estimates by London borough (2021/22)

Note: Personal well-being is assessed through four measures: Life Satisfaction, feeling the things done in life are Worthwhile, Happiness, and Anxiety. All four measures are presented in the data table, whereas the chart focusses on Anxiety and Life Satisfaction. The mean averages provide an overall estimate of personal well-being by geography. Due to differences in sample size there should be caution in making comparisons across across the different regions. Although this data is retrieved from the ONS, it is originally based on the Annual Population Survey (APS). The personal well-being scale ranges from 0 to 10, where 0 signifies an individual not experiencing the specific measure at all and 10 represents experiencing it to the highest level. The years span the period between April and March.
Data source: Personal well-being in the UK, ONS
London's Poverty Profile is created by charitable funder Trust for London, and economic and public policy consultancy, WPI Economics
